data.name: Fund Flow
content: FundFlow is {{full-stack}} automated banking app that I built in order to provide {{high-quality}} and {{easy to use}} bank transfers between personal bank accounts.
It was built after I realised managing multiple direct debits in separate apps was getting too complicated.
FundFlow is designed using {{Next.js}} as a front-end framework, and {{Appwrite}} as a backend framework for managing user data and transactions
It uses banking technologies such as {{Plaid}} and {{Dwolla}} to link between accounts

data.name: Slime Mould Colony Simulation
content: The {{Slime Mould Colony Simulation}} is a {{C++}} project that models the behavior of the slime mold Physarum polycephalum.
In this simulation, {{complex patterns}} and {{evolutionary behaviors}} emerge from the interactions of simple, {{particle-like agents}} governed by a straightforward {{local ruleset}}.
The project demonstrates how intricate structures can arise from basic algorithms, reflecting the {{self-organizing}} nature of {{biological systems}}.

data.name: Custom Programming Language
content: The project involved designing a {{syntax}} and {{grammar}} that could be easily parsed and interpreted.
I implemented the {{lexer}} to break down the pseudocode into {{tokens}} for processing.
The custom language supports basic {{control structures}} and {{data types}}, allowing for simple program logic.
Through this project, I gained a deeper understanding of {{language design}} and {{compiler theory}}.

data.name: Rust HTTP Server
content: The project is a {{Rust}}-based {{HTTP server}} designed to handle {{curl requests}} efficiently.
It utilizes {{JSON objects}} to {{store documents}}, enabling flexible data management.
The server supports basic {{CRUD operations}}, allowing users to create, read, update, and delete documents.
I implemented robust {{error handling}} and {{logging}} to ensure reliable performance and ease of debugging.

data.name: Convolutional Neural Network
content: The project features a {{Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)}} written entirely from scratch in {{Java}}.
I designed the {{user interface (UI)}} using {{Java Swing}}, providing an interactive experience for users.
The CNN uses the {{Extended MNIST dataset}} for {{optical character recognition (OCR)}} tasks.
The implementation does not rely on any {{pre-existing libraries}}, showcasing a custom approach to neural network development.
